title: Events & Spaces
description: Our events are where it all happens. We meet to learn, create, consult, and sometimes just to have a drink and feel at home. Whether you're looking for an intense tech challenge or a chill evening of bar-side talks, we have a place for you.

eventTypes.title: DYKEATHON
eventTypes.description: 'We are here to make sure we have each other's backs.' Our mission is simple: to create a network that actually works for us. We don't wait for an invite to the table; we're building our own. This means:
features: Being the first point of contact: Whether you need a job referral, help prepping for an interview, or just want to talk through a professional dilemma with someone who truly gets it.
Opening the door: Helping anyone who wants to break into tech realize it's possible, and showing them the best way to get there.
No explanations needed: Creating events and meetups where our identity is the default, not something we have to justify or explain.

eventTypes.title: MEETUPS
eventTypes.description: Regular gatherings that keep our community connected. Panel talks, tech demos, community updates, and space to just show up as yourself ‚Äî no explanations needed.
features: Panel talks: Hear from queer women leading tech, building companies, and making change.
Community updates: Stay in the loop on what's happening across the LGBTQ+ tech space.
Low-pressure networking: Meet people, find your people, and leave with a warmer heart.

eventTypes.title: DRINK & DYKE
eventTypes.description: Our casual, no-agenda bar nights. These events are all about unwinding, making friends, and enjoying a relaxed evening together.

singleEvents.title: Dykeathon 2026
about: The Dykeathon is a 24-hour hackathon for queer women and non-binary people in tech. We come together to build, create, and make lasting connections ‚Äî because we don't wait for an invite to the table; we build our own.

This year we're partnering with the LGBTQ+ Center in Tel Aviv to bring the community together for a day of innovation, challenge, and solidarity. Whether you're a developer, designer, product manager, or just curious about tech ‚Äî there's a place for you here.
All skill levels are welcome. All we ask is that you show up ready to connect and create.

program.title: Doors Open & Registration
program.description: Coffee, breakfast, and mingling. Come early, meet your teammates.

program.title: Opening Ceremony
program.description: Welcome from the organizers, introduction to the challenge themes, and team formation.

program.title: Hacking Begins
program.description: Teams get to work. Mentors and experts available for consultation throughout the day.

program.title: Lunch Break
program.description: Shared lunch provided. Workshops and talks running in parallel.

program.title: Afternoon Sprint
program.description: Back to building. Mentorship continues, energy drinks provided.

program.title: Project Presentations
program.description: Each team presents their project to the judges and the community. 5 minutes per team.

program.title: Judging & Awards
program.description: Judges deliberate. Winners announced across multiple categories.

program.title: Closing Party
program.description: We celebrate together. Drinks, dancing, and the dyke network growing stronger.

tracks.title: Community Tech
tracks.description: Build tools that serve the LGBTQ+ community ‚Äî apps, platforms, or services that address real needs.

tracks.title: Career & Mentorship
tracks.description: Create resources for queer women breaking into tech ‚Äî job boards, peer support systems, mentorship platforms.

tracks.title: Open Challenge
tracks.description: Build anything that excites your team. We're here for creativity and ambition.

singleEvents.title: Dykeathon 3.0
singleEvents.tagline: Tech for those who fight for us
about: Dykeathon 3.0 was hosted in the building of the LGBTQ+ TLV center ‚Äî bringing together queer women in product and tech to build real solutions for 10 LGBTQ+ and community organizations.

Teams worked directly with organizations including Beit El-Mim, Achva, the TLV LGBTQ+ Center, Rakafot, and community groups responding to the events of October 7th ‚Äî building tools that ranged from digital archives and volunteer management platforms to WhatsApp bots and housing portals.
Projects like the Gay Media Archive, SeniorVIP, and the Shared Parenting Portal showed just how much is possible when queer women in tech show up for their community.

tracks.title: Beit El-Mim
tracks.description: Website upgrade for the Arab LGBTQ+ community organization.

tracks.title: Achva
tracks.description: WhatsApp/Telegram bot, volunteer management platform, and alumni community tools.

tracks.title: TLV LGBTQ+ Center
tracks.description: SeniorVIP support platform, Gay Media Archive, Shared Parenting Portal, and Rainbow Root community hub.

tracks.title: Rakafot & Community Response
tracks.description: Over the Rainbow project plus war-response tools including SafeYouth (Sderot), Community Activist Management, and Locate Residents (Mevo'ot Hermon).

singleEvents.title: Dykeathon 2.0
about: Hosted in the Microsoft Reactor space, Dykeathon 2.0 had 200 participants on board to solve the biggest problems of LGBTQ+ non-profit organizations ‚Äî creating production-ready tools for organizations to implement in their day-to-day activities.

8 organizations participated: Bet El-Mem (Arab LGBTQ+), Maavarim (trans advocacy), Haguda, the TLV LGBTQ+ Center, Hoshen, LGBTech, Achva, and the Gila Project for Trans Empowerment. Each org came with a C-level leader and a real challenge.
This edition leaned heavily into GenAI and LLMs, with teams building faster and smarter than ever before. Bet El-Mem took first place, Maavarim second, and Haguda third.

tracks.title: ü•á Bet El-Mem
tracks.description: First place ‚Äî tech solutions for the Arab LGBTQ+ community organization.

tracks.title: ü•à Maavarim
tracks.description: Second place ‚Äî digital tools for trans advocacy and support.

tracks.title: ü•â Haguda
tracks.description: Third place ‚Äî platform work for LGBTQ+ community organizing.

program.title: Day 1 ‚Äî Kickoff & Team Formation
program.description: Introductions, challenge briefings, and matching PMs with organizations.

program.title: Hacking Begins
program.description: 24-hour build sprint starts. Teams work directly with org representatives.

program.title: Lunch
program.description: Food, mentors, and energy drinks to keep everyone going.

program.title: Late-Night Checkpoint
program.description: Mentors circulate, teams share progress and blockers.

program.title: Day 2 ‚Äî Final Push
program.description: Morning of the final day ‚Äî wrapping up builds, preparing presentations.

program.title: Project Presentations
program.description: Each team presents to judges and the full community.

program.title: Awards & Closing
program.description: Winners announced. Community celebration.

singleEvents.title: Dykeathon 1.0
about: The very first Dykeathon was hosted in Unity (formally IronSource) offices ‚Äî 100 participants got to know 4 major issues of the LGBTQ community: Safety, Legal, Community IRL, and Health, and created MVPs for products addressing those problems.
Teams were guided by domain experts: Dr. Ruth Gofen (Health), Adv. Michal Eden (Legal), Ayala Azulay (Safety), and Noa Dagan (Community).

Standout MVPs included LesBMe in Health (ü•á), BigSister in Community (ü•à), Standart in Safety (ü•â), and HelpMeSue in Legal. The night ended with an after-party at Shpagat ‚Äî and the knowledge that we'd do it all again, bigger.

tracks.title: ü•á Health ‚Äî LesBMe
tracks.description: First place: a platform addressing healthcare gaps for queer women.

tracks.title: ü•à Community ‚Äî BigSister
tracks.description: Second place: a peer support and mentorship network for LGBTQ+ women in tech.

tracks.title: ü•â Safety ‚Äî Standart
tracks.description: Third place: safety tools and resources for the LGBTQ+ community.

tracks.title: Legal ‚Äî HelpMeSue
tracks.description: Tools to help community members understand and exercise their legal rights.

program.title: Doors Open & Registration
program.description: Coffee, food, and meeting your teammates.

program.title: Opening Ceremony
program.description: Welcome, challenge briefings, and team formation across 4 domains.

program.title: Hacking Begins
program.description: Teams get to work with domain experts available for consultation.

program.title: Lunch Break
program.description: Shared lunch. Domain experts host office hours.

program.title: Afternoon Sprint
program.description: Final build push. Mentors in the room.

program.title: Project Presentations
program.description: Each team presents to judges and the community.

program.title: Awards Ceremony
program.description: Winners announced in Health, Safety, Community, and Legal categories.

program.title: After Party ‚Äî Shpagat
program.description: The celebration continues until 02:00.

singleEvents.title: Hanukkah Meetup
about: Hosted at the Pagaya office, 150 participants were thrilled to hear our four speakers talking about women innovation at war times.
The evening also served as a teaser for Dykeathon 3.0, coming in April 2024 ‚Äî with a first look at the challenge tracks and organizations we'd be working with.
Beer, pizza, and sufganiyot provided. Spots were limited, community was full.

program.title: Doors Open
program.description: Food, drinks, and catching up with the community.

program.title: Panel ‚Äî Women Innovation at War Times
program.description: Hear from 4 speakers talking about women innovation at war times ‚Äî projects that made a difference.

program.title: Dykeathon 3.0 Teaser
program.description: A first look at what's coming in April 2024 ‚Äî the organizations, the challenges, the vision.

program.title: Open Networking
program.description: Mingle, connect, and eat sufganiyot. Happy Hanukkah.

singleEvents.title: Meetup Nov 2024
about: Hosted at the Island office, 200 participants were thrilled to hear our 3 amazing women share about psychological and medical therapy alongside high-tech.
A workshop was held on a coding software that integrates a language model ‚Äî hands-on, practical, and energizing.
One of our biggest meetups yet. The community keeps growing.

program.title: Doors Open
program.description: Food, drinks, and mingling.

program.title: Speakers ‚Äî Therapy Meets Tech
program.description: 3 speakers sharing about psychological and medical therapy alongside high-tech innovation.

program.title: Workshop ‚Äî AI-Integrated Coding
program.description: Hands-on workshop on a coding software that integrates a language model.

program.title: Open Networking
program.description: Connect, collaborate, and keep the conversation going.

singleEvents.title: Dykeathon 4.0
about: Dykeathon 4.0 was our biggest edition yet ‚Äî 14 LGBTQ+ organizations, each matched with a dedicated team of queer women in tech to build real tools for their day-to-day work.

Organizations spanned community, health, mental health, sports, legal, and advocacy ‚Äî from grassroots groups to established centers. Teams brought fullstack engineers, frontend developers, data specialists, designers, and automation experts.
From WhatsApp bots to scraping tools, Monday integrations to custom web platforms ‚Äî every project shipped with a real organization behind it.
